intro: Oxytropis tiroliensis, commonly known as the Alpine milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to pale green pea-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Oxytropis tiroliensis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat.
